notes: gl_ledgers stores ledger definitions, uniquely identified by ledger_id. Ledgers are fundamental for financial reporting. Key fields include currency_code, chart_of_accounts_id, and period_set_name. An Oracle EBS instance can have multiple ledgers, each typically representing a separate company. A ledger is a critical accounting entity from which financial statements are generated. Key attributes include currency_code (accounting currency), chart_of_accounts_id (the COA structure used), accounted_period_type (linked to gl_periods.period_type), and period_set_name (from gl_calendars). ledger_category_code classifies ledgers as PRIMARY or REPORTING, with PRIMARY being the most common for operational and financial queries.
